wikipedia_page.main: Stephen "Steve" Shaw (born 1 January 1963) is a former professional tennis player from England who competed for Great Britain.

Chris became a professional tennis player at the age of 19, in June 1987, with a provisional ranking of 625 in the world, winning his first match against fellow Englishman and world No. 202 Steve Shaw at the Bristol grass court tournament, losing in the next round to former world No. 5 Henri Leconte. Later that month he reached the second round at Wimbledon, losing to future world No. 4 Brad Gilbert.
David Felgate /  Steve Shaw defeated  Libor Pimek /  Blaine Willenborg 6–4, 5–7,

He and fellow Englishman Steve Shaw were doubles champions in the 1985 Bordeaux Open.ATP World Tour Profile It would be his only title on the Grand Prix tennis circuit. Also that year, in Wimbledon, Felgate won his first Grand Slam doubles match. Felgate and Nick Brown, wild card entrants, upset third seeds Ken Flach and Robert Seguso in the first round, before losing in the second round. He also reached the second round at Wimbledon in 1986, with Shaw, and in 1988, with Nick Fulwood.
Turner and partner Andrew Castle were doubles semi-finalists at the 1986 Bristol Open.ATP World Tour Profile He also made the second round of the singles draw, after beating Steve Shaw.

Theine lost his only Grand Slam singles match, at the 1988 Australian Open, to American Paul Chamberlin.ATP World Tour Profile He also competed in the men's doubles, with Steve Shaw, but was unable to make it past the opening round. His two other Grand Slam appearances were both in the men's doubles, with Heiner Moraing at the 1989 Australian Open and Gavin Pfitzner at the 1990 Wimbledon Championships.
